title: Scotland quietly seething as they face World Cup elimination if World Rugby sticks to its rules in face of Typhoon Hagibis
text:
Speaking through teeth that could grind diamonds into dust, Scotland head coach Gregor Townsend described the prospect of their final Pool A match against Japan being cancelled as “very unusual” and “strange”. For such masterful disguise of his actual feelings, Townsend should be awarded the Nobel Prize in diplomacy.

In public, Scotland are projecting total confidence that what should be a quarter-final decider in Yokohama will take place on Sunday evening, pointing to the sunny skies that are forecast to follow Typhoon Hagibis into Tokyo.
